thread.title: Lamborghini Centenario: Veneno successor to be announced at Geneva 2016
thread.title_full: Lamborghini Centenario: Veneno successor to be announced at Geneva 2016

author: HARRY TUCKER
title: Lamborghini Centenario: Veneno successor to be announced at Geneva 2016
text:
NOT one to let the likes of Ferrari and McLaren share the crown of the world’s most desired car, Lamborghini is set to reveal an ultra-exclusive hypercar early next year.
According to French TV network TF1 , Lamborghini’s upcoming model will be known as the Centenario LP770-4, honouring the centenary of the birth of the company’s founder, Ferruccio Lamborghini. Lamborghini was born in April 28, 1916 and founded his famous car company to rival Ferrari in 1963.
In terms of power, the new Lamborghini is expected to feature an uprated version of the 6.5-litre V12 engine in the Aventador that will deliver 556kW of power, or 770-horsepower, which is where the second part of the car’s name comes from.
It will be paired with an all-wheel drive system and seven-speed dual-clutch automatic gearbox that will help propel the hypercar from 0-100km/h in 2.7 seconds and give it a top speed in excess of 350km/h.
Lamborghini’s Veneno has been the company’s most exclusive car. Source: Supplied
Lamborghini’s last hypercar, the Veneno roadster was released in 2013, and like the Centenario, was based on the existing Aventador platform, producing 552kW of power. Asking price was over $6.5 million and production was limited to just nine cars.
The new hypercar is expected to be revealed at the 2016 Geneva motorshow in March, with 20 to be made at price of over $1.6 million each.
